result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Pundsack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50+ costs = $516   , to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 6/1/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott A. Pundsack

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with attached JI's and Criminal Case Settlement

Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 3:12pm [mo]
Defendant Scott A. Pundsack in court with attorney John Robert Dade.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $50+ costs = $516   , to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 6/1/16 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 20 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.
recess:3:25pm
Status conference on May 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2016 at 11:20 am.

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:40am.
Defendant Scott A. Pundsack in court with Attorney John R. Dade.  ADA Monica Hall appear for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Ronald Gilstrap
--no possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take any prescription drugs as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
recess 9:42am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/30/16 at 11:20am  (2)  Status Conference on 5/6/16 at 3:00pm
